Message.Title: Yahoo options - think it through
Message.Msg: Ok, how can yahoo get the most out of its Alibaba investment? They can sell off 1b without taxes, since they paid that much for Alibaba stake, So lets agree on the first billion in cash (cashing out) Now they can either take the rest in cash or equities. If equities they they avoid taxes in cash they pay taxes. So, if they decide to pursue acquisitions, why not structure it before the actual transaction and take equities instead of cash (this ups their equity by about two billion in tax savings. The announced plan suggested that they would take some in preferred Alibaba shares (in the projected IPO). Preferred shares generally pay out a dividend/interest that common shares do not (note Berkshire's Bank of America preferred holdings). So, this is one way of avoiding taxes and assuring a 6-7%/y gain in a growing company. There are a wide range of other options in the: Why pay 4 billion in cash to shareholders and 2 billion to the IRS category. If Yahoo and Alibaba are planning on an expansion of the US brand of Alibaba and Alibaba holds equities that it bought in the US, then trade them to Yahoo, and have that as a basis for a yahoo stake in that operation. Note that yahoo still will hold a % of the whole which is likely to grow. This way they would increase their growth. As for the 1 billion that they cash out buy back shares to give shareholders a return that actually grow over time as other structural investments payoff and Yahoo moves up in pps. Ok...what are your ideas???
